intro: Affonsea, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in long, drooping clusters. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Affonsea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can also be used in traditional medicine.
